messageBody:
Elaine Prata wrote:
> I'm a Java Programmer and I have some questions about
> Unit Tests. First: how can I do test code for code that access
> database? The question is: put the data in a property file? This
> is very expensive... It require a framework for access the data
> too... In a project I see that. Make the test is expensive.
> Exist a alternative? In another project I don't have used
> property files. I test the method of insert using the method for
> search (the data inserted is in the collection?) but I think
> this is not very good... How do that so?

Google "Dallaway unit test database". There is a good article to help
you get started.

Also, buy the book JUnit Recipes, which provides tips for how to test
code that uses a database.

I suggest that you start writing tests the best way you can, then
observe what you like and don't like about those tests (speed,
simplicitly, clarity, effectiveness), then come back and ask more
specific questions about how to improve your tests. This will help you
learn much more effectively than just following our advice.

Good luck!
